Why You'll Never Get Another Stimulus Check ...  to the disruptors. If I had told you 10 years ago that disruptors like PayPal would be worth more than big important banks like Wells Fargo or Citibank, you would have laughed at me. But it's easy to see how the tables have turned. Over the past decade, disruptors have picked off businesses that banks used to dominate one-by-one. Remember, Intuit's Quicken Loans is America's largest mortgage lender, Apps like PayPal's Venmo and Square's Cash App have largely replaced bank wires. And robo-advisors that give you automated, financial planning services are stealing banks lucrative wealth management business. In short, disruptors have seized banks' most profitable businesses, and left them with the scraps. Banks will continue losing ...

How To Support Employees Experiencing Grief And Loss ... very irritable. Irritability is a part of grief that isn't talked about as much as sadness or anger. Let your employees feel these feelings without fear of reprisal. Granted, there are limits — employees should excuse themselves if they need some time. If they are having a rough day, let them go home for the rest of the day, with pay. When people are told (or intuit) that they need to hold feelings of grief in, the more those feelings get deeply entrenched. Let your employees be human. Have a room in the office where employees can go if they need time alone. Give Them Paid Time Off We are living in extraordinary circumstances, and that calls for extraordinary measures.
